PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Audit virtual machines for Trusted Launch support

PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Trusted Launch must be used on supported virtual machines for enhanced security.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This Policy initiative is a group of Policy definitions that help optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Policy initiative as a cost control to reveal orphaned resources that are driving cost.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Unused resources driving cost must be avoided.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyDescription: Optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Azure Policy Initiative as a cost control tool to reveal orphaned resources that are contributing cost.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyNameClear: Microsoft cloud security benchmark
PolicyDescription: The Microsoft cloud security benchmark initiative represents the policies and controls implementing security recommendations defined in Microsoft cloud security benchmark, see https://aka.ms/azsecbm. This also serves as the Microsoft Defender for Cloud default policy initiative. You can directly assign this initiative, or manage its policies and compliance results within Microsoft Defender for Cloud.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This Policy initiative is a group of Policy definitions that help optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Policy initiative as a cost control to reveal orphaned resources that are driving cost.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Unused resources driving cost must be avoided.

PolicyDescription: Optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Azure Policy Initiative as a cost control tool to reveal orphaned resources that are contributing cost.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway

PolicyNameClear: Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway
PolicyDescription: Deploy Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) in front of public facing web applications for additional inspection of incoming traffic. Web Application Firewall (WAF) provides centralized protection of your web applications from common exploits and vulnerabilities such as SQL injections, Cross-Site Scripting, local and remote file executions. You can also restrict access to your web applications by countries, IP address ranges, and other http(s) parameters via custom rules.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies the network interfaces which enabled IP forwarding. The setting of IP forwarding disables Azure's check of the source and destination for a network interface. This should be reviewed by the network security team.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Network interfaces must disable IP forwarding.

PolicyNameClear: Management port access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows management port access from the Internet, by default blocking SSH/RDP ports.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Audit requirement of Secure transfer in your storage account. Secure transfer is an option that forces your storage account to accept requests only from secure connections (HTTPS). Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Secure transfer to storage accounts must be enabled.

PolicyNameClear: Subnets should have a Network Security Group

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Backup on virtual machines without a given tag must be configured to a new recovery services vault with a default policy.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure periodic checking for missing system updates on azure virtual machines and Arc-enabled virtual machines.
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure auto-assessment (every 24 hours) for OS updates. You can control the scope of assignment according to machine subscription, resource group, location or tag. Learn more about this for Windows: https://aka.ms/computevm-windowspatchassessmentmode, for Linux: https://aka.ms/computevm-linuxpatchassessmentmode.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Periodic checking of missing updates must be enabled.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Use of HTTPS ensures authentication and protects data in transit from network layer eavesdropping attacks. PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Do not allow deletion of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy provides a safeguard against accidental removal of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA by blocking delete calls using deny action effect.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: This resource must be compliant with the assigned policy.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Do not allow deletion of specified resource and resource type
PolicyDescription: This policy enables you to specify the resource and resource type that your organization can protect from accidentals deletion by blocking delete calls using the deny action effect.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Trusted Launch Guest Attestation must be configured on applicable virtual machines.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This Policy initiative is a group of Policy definitions that help optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Policy initiative as a cost control to reveal orphaned resources that are driving cost.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Unused resources driving cost must be avoided.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyDescription: Optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Azure Policy Initiative as a cost control tool to reveal orphaned resources that are contributing cost.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Deny the deployment of classic resources

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Trusted Launch Guest Attestation must be configured on applicable virtual machines.

Learn more about this for Windows: https://aka.ms/computevm-windowspatchassessmentmode, for Linux: https://aka.ms/computevm-linuxpatchassessmentmode.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Periodic checking of missing updates must be enabled.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This Policy initiative is a group of Policy definitions that help optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Policy initiative as a cost control to reveal orphaned resources that are driving cost.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Unused resources driving cost must be avoided.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyDescription: Optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Azure Policy Initiative as a cost control tool to reveal orphaned resources that are contributing cost.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. PolicyDescription: Microsoft Defender for Containers provides cloud-native Kubernetes security capabilities including environment hardening, workload protection, and run-time protection. When you enable the SecurityProfile.Defender on your Azure Kubernetes Service cluster, an agent is deployed to your cluster to collect security event data. Learn more about Microsoft Defender for Containers: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/defender-for-containers-introduction?tabs=defender-for-container-arch-aks.

PolicyAssignmentDescription: This Policy initiative is a group of Policy definitions that help optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Policy initiative as a cost control to reveal orphaned resources that are driving cost.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Unused resources driving cost must be avoided.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590

PolicyDescription: Optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Azure Policy Initiative as a cost control tool to reveal orphaned resources that are contributing cost.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Deny the deployment of classic resources
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Denies deployment of classic resource types under the assigned scope.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.

PolicyDescription: This policy denies the network interfaces which are configured with any public IP. This should be reviewed by the network security team.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assign the WAF should be enabled for Application Gateway audit policy.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Web Application Firewall (WAF) must be enabled for Application Gateway.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway
PolicyDescription: Deploy Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) in front of public facing web applications for additional inspection of incoming traffic. Web Application Firewall (WAF) provides centralized protection of your web applications from common exploits and vulnerabilities such as SQL injections, Cross-Site Scripting, local and remote file executions. You can also restrict access to your web applications by countries, IP address ranges, and other http(s) parameters via custom rules.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies the network interfaces which enabled IP forwarding. The setting of IP forwarding disables Azure's check of the source and destination for a network interface. This should be reviewed by the network security team.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Network interfaces must disable IP forwarding.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the network interfaces which enabled IP forwarding. The setting of IP forwarding disables Azure's check of the source and destination for a network interface. This should be reviewed by the network security team.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Management port access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows management port access from the Internet
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Management port access from the Internet must be blocked.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Management port access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows management port access from the Internet, by default blocking SSH/RDP ports.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
PolicyDescription: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
PolicyDescription: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Audit requirement of Secure transfer in your storage account. Secure transfer is an option that forces your storage account to accept requests only from secure connections (HTTPS). Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Secure transfer to storage accounts must be enabled.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled

Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies the creation of a subnet without a Network Security Group to protect traffic across subnets.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Subnets must have a Network Security Group.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the creation of a subnet without a Network Security Group. NSG help to protect traffic across subnet-level.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure SQL servers to have auditing enabled to Log Analytics workspace
PolicyAssignmentDescription: To ensure the operations performed against your SQL assets are captured, SQL servers should have auditing enabled. If auditing is not enabled, this policy will configure auditing events to flow to the specified Log Analytics workspace.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Deny or Deploy and append TLS requirements and SSL enforcement on resources without Encryption in transit
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Choose either Deploy if not exist and append in combination with audit or Select Deny in the Policy effect. Deny polices shift left. Deploy if not exist and append enforce but can be changed, and because missing existence condition require then the combination of Audit.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: TLS and SSL must be enabled for on resources without encryption in transit.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Backup on virtual machines without a given tag must be configured to a new recovery services vault with a default policy.

PolicyDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Do not allow deletion of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy provides a safeguard against accidental removal of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA by blocking delete calls using deny action effect.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: This resource must be compliant with the assigned policy.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Do not allow deletion of specified resource and resource type
PolicyDescription: This policy enables you to specify the resource and resource type that your organization can protect from accidentals deletion by blocking delete calls using the deny action effect.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Trusted Launch Guest Attestation must be configured on applicable virtual machines.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590

PolicyDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure Advanced Threat Protection to be enabled on open-source relational databases
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Enable Advanced Threat Protection on your non-Basic tier open-source relational databases to detect anomalous activities indicating unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit databases. See https://aka.ms/AzDforOpenSourceDBsDocu.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Advanced Threat Protection must be enabled on open-source relational databases.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590

By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Management port access from the Internet should be blocked

PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Management port access from the Internet must be blocked.

PolicyNameClear: Management port access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows management port access from the Internet, by default blocking SSH/RDP ports.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Deny the creation of public IP
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies creation of Public IPs under the assigned scope.

PolicyNameClear: Not allowed resource types
PolicyDescription: Restrict which resource types can be deployed in your environment. Limiting resource types can reduce the complexity and attack surface of your environment while also helping to manage costs. Compliance results are only shown for non-compliant resources.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies the creation of a subnet without a Network Security Group to protect traffic across subnets.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Subnets must have a Network Security Group.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the creation of a subnet without a Network Security Group. NSG help to protect traffic across subnet-level.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Backup on virtual machines without a given tag must be configured to a new recovery services vault with a default policy.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Do not allow deletion of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy provides a safeguard against accidental removal of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA by blocking delete calls using deny action effect.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: This resource must be compliant with the assigned policy.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Do not allow deletion of specified resource and resource type
PolicyDescription: This policy enables you to specify the resource and resource type that your organization can protect from accidentals deletion by blocking delete calls using the deny action effect.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Trusted Launch Guest Attestation must be configured on applicable virtual machines.

PolicyNameClear: Configure Azure Kubernetes Service clusters to enable Defender profile
PolicyDescription: Microsoft Defender for Containers provides cloud-native Kubernetes security capabilities including environment hardening, workload protection, and run-time protection. When you enable the SecurityProfile.Defender on your Azure Kubernetes Service cluster, an agent is deployed to your cluster to collect security event data. Learn more about Microsoft Defender for Containers: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/defender-for-containers-introduction?tabs=defender-for-container-arch-aks.

PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Configure Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes clusters to install Microsoft Defender for Cloud extension
PolicyDescription: Microsoft Defender for Cloud extension for Azure Arc provides threat protection for your Arc enabled Kubernetes clusters. The extension collects data from all nodes in the cluster and sends it to the Azure Defender for Kubernetes backend in the cloud for further analysis. Learn more in https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/defender-for-containers-enable?pivots=defender-for-container-arc.

PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Do not allow deletion of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy provides a safeguard against accidental removal of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA by blocking delete calls using deny action effect.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: This resource must be compliant with the assigned policy.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Do not allow deletion of specified resource and resource type
PolicyDescription: This policy enables you to specify the resource and resource type that your organization can protect from accidentals deletion by blocking delete calls using the deny action effect.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Trusted Launch Guest Attestation must be configured on applicable virtual machines.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This Policy initiative is a group of Policy definitions that help optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Policy initiative as a cost control to reveal orphaned resources that are driving cost.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Unused resources driving cost must be avoided.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Unused resources driving cost should be avoided
PolicyDescription: Optimize cost by detecting unused but chargeable resources. Leverage this Azure Policy Initiative as a cost control tool to reveal orphaned resources that are contributing cost.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.

PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assign the WAF should be enabled for Application Gateway audit policy.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Web Application Firewall (WAF) must be enabled for Application Gateway.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway
PolicyDescription: Deploy Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) in front of public facing web applications for additional inspection of incoming traffic. Web Application Firewall (WAF) provides centralized protection of your web applications from common exploits and vulnerabilities such as SQL injections, Cross-Site Scripting, local and remote file executions. You can also restrict access to your web applications by countries, IP address ranges, and other http(s) parameters via custom rules.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies the network interfaces which enabled IP forwarding. The setting of IP forwarding disables Azure's check of the source and destination for a network interface. This should be reviewed by the network security team.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Network interfaces must disable IP forwarding.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Management port access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows management port access from the Internet
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Management port access from the Internet must be blocked.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Management port access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows management port access from the Internet, by default blocking SSH/RDP ports.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
PolicyDescription: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
PolicyDescription: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Audit requirement of Secure transfer in your storage account. Secure transfer is an option that forces your storage account to accept requests only from secure connections (HTTPS). Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Secure transfer to storage accounts must be enabled.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.

PolicyAssignmentDescription: Choose either Deploy if not exist and append in combination with audit or Select Deny in the Policy effect. Deny polices shift left. Deploy if not exist and append enforce but can be changed, and because missing existence condition require then the combination of Audit.

PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyNameClear: Microsoft cloud security benchmark
PolicyDescription: The Microsoft cloud security benchmark initiative represents the policies and controls implementing security recommendations defined in Microsoft cloud security benchmark, see https://aka.ms/azsecbm. You can directly assign this initiative, or manage its policies and compliance results within Microsoft Defender for Cloud.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.

PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy provides a safeguard against accidental removal of the User Assigned Managed Identity used by AMA by blocking delete calls using deny action effect.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Trusted Launch Guest Attestation must be configured on applicable virtual machines.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Enable Azure Monitor for Virtual Machine Scale Sets
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Enable Azure Monitor for the Virtual Machine Scale Sets in the specified scope (Management group, Subscription or resource group). Takes Log Analytics workspace as parameter. Note: if your scale set upgradePolicy is set to Manual, you need to apply the extension to the all VMs in the set by calling upgrade on them. In CLI this would be az vmss update-instances.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Azure Monitor must be enabled for Virtual Machines Scales Sets.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure periodic checking for missing system updates on azure virtual machines and Arc-enabled virtual machines.
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure auto-assessment (every 24 hours) for OS updates. You can control the scope of assignment according to machine subscription, resource group, location or tag. PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Resources should be Zone Resilient.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Resources must be Zone Resilient.
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP MI Usr, ObjectDisplayName: id-alz-mgmt-eastus2-apply-001, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: bbd0bbbd-16fc-4c39-a530-65ced78b7590
PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Resources should be Zone Resilient
PolicyDescription: Some resource types can be deployed Zone Redundant (e.g. SQL Databases); some can be deploy Zone Aligned (e.g. Virtual Machines); and some can be deployed either Zone Aligned or Zone Redundant (e.g. Virtual Machine Scale Sets). Being zone aligned does not guarantee resilience, but it is the foundation on which a resilient solution can be built (e.g. three Virtual Machine Scale Sets zone aligned to three different zones in the same region with a load balancer). See https://aka.ms/AZResilience for more info.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure subscriptions to enable service health alert monitoring rule
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Assignable at the subscription or management group level, this policy ensures that each subscription has a service health alert rule configured with alert conditions and mapping to action groups as specified in the policy parameters. By default creates a resource group, alert rule and action group configured to send emails to subscription owners for all service health events.
PolicyAssignmentNonComplianceMessages: Service Health alerts must be configured on all subscriptions.
PolicyAssignmentParameters: actionGroupResources=@{actionGroupEmail=System.Object[]; eventHubResourceId=System.Object[]; functionResourceId=; functionTriggerUrl=; logicappCallbackUrl=; logicappResourceId=; webhookServiceUri=System.Object[]}, actionGroupRoleIds=Owner, resourceGroupLocation=${default_location}

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Configure prerequisites to enable Guest Attestation on Trusted Launch enabled VMs
PolicyAssignmentDescription: Configure the Trusted Launch enabled virtual machines to automatically install the Guest Attestation extension and enable system-assigned managed identity to allow Azure Security Center to proactively attest and monitor the boot integrity. Boot integrity is attested via Remote Attestation. For more details, please refer to the following link - https://aka.ms/trustedlaunch.

PolicyNameClear: Configure SQL VMs and Arc-enabled SQL Servers to install Microsoft Defender for SQL and AMA with a user-defined LA workspace

PolicyNameClear: Configure Azure Kubernetes Service clusters to enable Defender profile
PolicyDescription: Microsoft Defender for Containers provides cloud-native Kubernetes security capabilities including environment hardening, workload protection, and run-time protection. When you enable the SecurityProfile.Defender on your Azure Kubernetes Service cluster, an agent is deployed to your cluster to collect security event data. Learn more about Microsoft Defender for Containers: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/defender-for-containers-introduction?tabs=defender-for-container-arch-aks.

PolicyNameClear: [Preview]: Configure Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes clusters to install Microsoft Defender for Cloud extension
PolicyDescription: Microsoft Defender for Cloud extension for Azure Arc provides threat protection for your Arc enabled Kubernetes clusters. The extension collects data from all nodes in the cluster and sends it to the Azure Defender for Kubernetes backend in the cloud for further analysis. Learn more in https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/defender-for-containers-enable?pivots=defender-for-container-arc.
